title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg says return to work will have to be 'staggered'
text: The social network is requiring most of its employees to work from home until at least the end of May.

title: Facebook Canceling All Events With 50 Or More Attendees Until June 2021, Zuckerberg Encourages Working From Home
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced that the company will hold no real-life meetups for more than a year, and has encouraged his staff to continue working from home during the pandemic. Zuckerberg posted today that all planned Facebook physical events with 50 or more attendees were canceled until June 2021, but that some virtual

title: Facebook Revamps Cryptocurrency Libra
text: Facebook is responding to criticism from regulators and making changes to its cryptocurrency project, Libra.

title: Facebook cancels all large, in-person events through June 2021
text: Facebook Inc. FB, -0.40% will cancel all of its in-person events with more than 50 people through June 2021, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said Thursday.

title: Facebook Cancels Large Group Events Through June 2021 Due To COVID-19
text: The social media giant's employees will also be allowed to continue working from home as late as this summer, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said.

title: Facebook cancels all large events through June 2021, Zuckerberg says
text: Facebook is canceling all large gatherings until June 2021, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced Thursday. The social network is also extending its requirement that employees work from home through the end of May, and will permit employees who don’t feel comfortable coming in to work remotely “through at least the summer.

title: Facebook cancels large in-person events through June 2021
text: Facebook is canceling all of its planned physical events with 50 or more people through June 2021 due to concerns about the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Libra Compromises Undermine Original Facebook Promise
text: In an effort to make regulator happy, the Libra Association founded by Facebook has winnowed away much of the promise its cryptocurrency plans offered to upgrade global finance

title: Facebook rebalances Libra cryptocurrency in bid for approval
text: Facebook’s planned cryptocurrency Libra will be linked to individual national currencies and overseen by global watchdogs in a scaled-back revamp it hopes will win regulatory approval. The prospect of Facebook’s 2.5 billion users adopting Libra has led to intense scrutiny from global regulators, with many worried its launch could erode national control over money.

title: Facebook Stock an Under-The-Radar Quarantine Winner
text: Like much of the rest of the market, FB stock is off to a rough start to 2020. However, while the coronavirus has created broad macroeconomic uncertainty, Facebook may actually benefit from the stay-at-home environment.

title: COVID-19 And Facebook: Several Unknowns, But Unrivaled Financial Strength
text: COVID-19 And Facebook: Several Unknowns, But Unrivaled Financial Strength

title: Facebook wants content reviewers back ASAP, slows return plan for most employees
text: On his personal Facebook account, Mark Zuckerberg offered an update on the company’s roadmap for bringing employees back to work in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. In the post, he acknowledged that while it might be possible for a small portion of “critical employees” unable to do their work remotely to return sooner, the […]

title: Zuckerberg: Facebook canceling large events through June 2021, will allow employees to work from home through the summer
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday announced that the company will allow its employees to work from home through the summer and it will not host any large events through June of 2021.

title: Facebook’s annual virtual reality conference goes virtual-only
text: While it quickly became clear that the tech and developer conference held during the spring would need to be cancelled due to COVID-19, tech companies are beginning to pull the plug on events taking place later in 2020. Today, Facebook announced that it would be shelving the in-person component of its virtual reality-focused Oculus Connect […]

title: Facebook scales back alternatives to F8 developers conference amid coronavirus outbreak
text: The social network cancelled F8 but was initially planning to host local events.

title: Facebook Gives Its Libra Digital Currency an Overhaul
text: The Libra Association will now support multiple versions of the digital token backed by fiat currencies.

title: Facebook to Notify Users Who Responded to COVID-19 Misinformation
text: The social media platform hopes to quell the impact of misleading coronavirus content.

title: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency gets revamp in response to backlash
text: Facebook's  planned cryptocurrency Libra will be linked to individual national currencies and overseen by global watchdogs in a scaled-back revamp it hopes will win regulatory approval.

title: How Instagram managed to survive antitrust scrutiny when it was acquired by Facebook
text: In Sarah Frier’s new book, ‘No Filter,’ she examines the phenomenon of Instagram. In this excerpt, she describes how it convinced naive regulators to allow its acquisition by Facebook in 2012.

title: Facebook’s Coronavirus Misinformation Policy At Odds With Political Ads Stance
text: Facebook will today begin alerting users who have seen or engaged with false coronavirus content. But it still won't warn users about false political ads.

title: Facebook-backed association revamps Libra following regulatory concerns
text: The Libra Association, the consortium created by Facebook to oversee all things Libra, has updated its white paper to make some changes. The association is abandoning its original plan to create a global stablecoin directly tied to a basket of fiat currencies and securities.

title: Facebook's cryptocurrency project gets watered down as it attempts to woo regulators
text: The independent group created by Facebook had run into regulatory hurdles with its plans to offer a coin backed by multiple currencies.

title: Facebook will start alerting users who have interacted with ‘harmful misinformation’ about COVID-19
text: Facebook this morning announced its latest step in effort to combat the spread of misinformation around the on-going COVID-19 pandemic. Chief among them is a new message targeting users who have commented on, reacted to or liked false content about the virus.

title: Facebook-Backed Libra Cryptocurrency Project Is Scaled Back
text: After months of criticism, the cryptocurrency is moving ahead with significant revisions.

title: Facebook Will Begin Warning You If You Interact With Fake Coronavirus News
text: A new feature will place red-flag notices in users' News Feeds.

title: Facebook will start warning people who 'like' or react to fake coronavirus news
text: Facebook, which has been criticized for its handling of health issues in the past, has made several coronavirus-related adjustments to its platform over the past few months.

title: Facebook ramps up crack down on coronavirus misinformation, Zuckerberg says
text: Facebook will let you know if you engaged with inaccurate information about the coronavirus.

title: Facebook to notify users who have engaged with harmful COVID-19 posts
text: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday it would start notifying users who had engaged with false posts about COVID-19 which could cause physical harm, such as drinking bleach to cure the virus, and connect them to accurate information.

title: Coronavirus: Facebook to warn users who engaged with 'harmful' misinformation
text: Users who have liked, shared or commented on posts with false claims will be directed to WHO’s ‘myth busters’ page

title: Facebook to alert users who interacted with COVID-19 misinformation
text: Facebook will show alerts to people who have previously interacted with misinformation about coronavirus - in the social network’s latest move to counter the spread of false information about the pandemic.
